JUST FOR TODAY 
 
 Before you start the five days, there is a phrase that deserves attention and reflection. In the precepts, Master Usui says «Just for today». This just for today does not mean that you will just do it on this day and forget about the next. Just for today means the practice of mindfulness - just for today, here and now, in mind and heart. When you start each of these days try to stay in the present moment, savoring each lesson, what you feel, what you think, and you will see that it makes all the difference. 
 
 
 HOW TO PERFORM THE FIVE DAYS 
 
 It is very simple: try to collect yourself in a quiet space, if you want, put on some serene music, sit down or lie down comfortably, preferably with your back straight. At the beginning of each day you have a poem by Emperor Meiji, which can help you to reflect. Meditate a little on what the beginning of the day tells you and what you would like to see transformed in you. How do you think Reiki can help you achieve that goal? 
 
 Also pay attention to your nutrition and hydration. Over these five days, try to eat a more balanced diet. Don't overeat red meats, sugar, alcohol and stimulants like coffee, green tea and tobacco. However, you must not leave something that can create anxiety. A balanced diet will only serve to prepare your body for attunement. The less toxins you have, the better. However, nothing impedes your course. Hydration is also very important, even to help the body get rid of toxins. If you can, drink 1.5 l of water a day, unless you feel bad about drinking so much. Taking care with food and hydration, you will have a more harmonized body and a higher energy frequency.

Today we start the first day of our journey. A joint trip but with a very personal and inner experience. And so is life, when we walk more awake. We work on the inside so that we can give more to the outside. I wish you a very beautiful and joyful path.

«Do not follow the past; don't get lost in the future. The past no longer exists, the future has not yet arrived. Deeply observing life as it is, here and now, we remain balanced and free. »
-Koan Zen

In this first day on the way, you will work on being here, the awareness of your root and the importance of the present. Do not cling to what happened, nor long for what will happen. You can only be happy now.
If you can, get yourself a notebook to ask questions and your thoughts. It will help you to understand the whole of this work and to understand in the future how you grew up.

* How do you feel at the moment?
* Do you think you are too attached to the past or wanting to live the future?
* How do you find life, here and now? Do you feel happy?
* What do you think keeps you from being happy right now?
* What are you going to do to make yourself happy in every moment, in the present?


Your root is what connects you to the land, to people. And building your tribe and your power, right now. And your affirmation and concretization. And survival as a being. With the red color you are not afraid and you have strength. It is the lowest vibration of all chakras, but it is the one that gives resistance to your body, which is a sacred temple. How do you get on with the Root Chakra? Do you feel in the here and now? Are you rooted? Do you feel integrated? Can you use red?
PRACTICES

On this first day, take a moment to become aware of yourself. Feel your feet on the floor and the air you breathe, Be aware of every single moment of life… Just for today. As rooting is important, dedicate yourself to this practice several times a day. If you uproot yourself frequently, don\'t worry, it\'s normal and your energetic body learns to take root. Throughout the day you become aware of the present moment… Feel the air, what you see, what you touch, what you taste.

In this second day of reflection and inner work, we will dedicate ourselves to our second chakra - to observe the goals of life, our freedom and our presence in the world. Observe the following questions and try to understand how you have been before yourself and before those around you:

* Do you practice the Five Principles and can you feel them in you? Are they part of your daily life and do you feel the transformation they bring you?
* Can you apply the second principle, just for today, am I calm, in the most difficult situations? If not, what do you think could help you achieve? What are you going to do to be more balanced in your decisions?
* What is your biggest life goal right now? Are you strong enough to do it? If not, how do you think you will achieve it and how can Reiki help?

The Splenic Chakra works with life goals, freedom, joy, creativity, sexuality, the intimate relationship with the other, the sexual organs. Check these situations in you:

* How do you relate to others? Do you feel an engaging and charismatic person?
* Do you have life goals?
* Do you feel free or embarrassed? Why?

Joy is very important for the Splenic Chakra;\n* Purify your emotions with Hesso Chiryo, which is a very vital technique for detoxification;\n* Practice the dry bath and the Reiki rain, to eliminate something that was left in your aura with the cleaning.

«What was your original face, the one you had before you were born?» - Koan Zen

Today you will find your personal power to consolidate it. Make that power of yours a force to help others and yourself.
Just for today, I'm grateful … What are you grateful for? Koan Zen refers to the reflection of “who am I really?”. This search for self, for true identity, becomes a more serene path when it is filled with gratitude - I thank you for all that I am, including the parts that are bad. I could say "less good" but no, we need to clearly identify what we often hide and, in the light of gratitude, unite as a whole. You are a whole, full of the things that are bad and good, and the result of that union is the incredible being that you manifest. Inside there is an extraordinary light - it's you.
On this day on the way, sit down. Feel your inner power! Review these questions:

* Do I know my limits? If not, what do I need to know me better?
* Do I know how to thank you for all the lessons I attribute to myself in life?
* Do I know how to use my personal power to build myself and help others to build themselves? If not, what do you need to do?

THE CHACRA OF THE SOLAR PLEXUS - MANIPURA

The Solar Plexus is the source of our personal power. Visualize it as a sun and you will understand that this is where your inner strength resides. On the right there is the liver and on the left the spleen - the purification and thoughts. The Solar Plexus is also called Sympathetic Chakra, because it remembers to absorb the dissonant energy that surrounds it, causing swelling in the belly, extreme feeling of accumulation and malaise, all because it is not able to process and transform the energy it has absorbed. This is the chakra by which we communicate our emotions; just notice that we fold our arms in front of the Solar Plexus when we want to close ourselves off from others. On this basis of power, it also reflects the following:

* Do I know how to deal with my emotions?
* Do I know myself fully and identify what I need?
* Am I dependent in any way?
* Do I have problems in the belly area?
Your work with the Solar Plexus involves understanding and accepting your personal power. Imagine a big sun, strong and incredibly hot - place it on your Solar Plexus Chakra. How do you feel?

* After your self-treatment, put one hand on the Solar Plexus and the other on the Heart Chakra, as it will help you to harmonize emotions with unconditional love. Let yourself be like this for a while;\n* Throughout the day try to put your hands like this, in moments of rest. Do you feel well?

«Reiki is the secret art of inviting happiness.» - Mikao Usui

In number four you find stability: the four sides, the square, the fourth chakra - the Heart. Unconditional love resonates with Reiki and the fourth chakra. Sit it down. Just for today, I work honestly - I work the truth and I share in truth. So is the fourth principle of Reiki, which coincides with the fourth heart chakra. When the heart beats and works, everything works and the inner world grows in beauty and overflows to the outside. The heart asks for simplicity and fulfillment. This cannot be exterior but interior. I am, full of me. Can you feel this way?

* Do you feel full? Totally? If not, what do you think is missing and how can you fill it out?
* What does the heart ask of you right now? If you listen, can you fulfill what he needs?

The fourth chakra is also called "inviolable". This treasure that we have in our hearts, unconditional love, the garden of our compassion, is priceless and is the inexhaustible source of what is most precious - love.
When we have a predisposed heart everything flows - it doesn't matter who is ahead, it flows. Energy fulfills its purpose and we feel fulfilled. The Heart Chakra is the engine of Reiki and the evolution of our consciousness - listen to what it has to say to you.

* Do you ever listen to your heart? What do you say often?
* Do you think you have more to give than to receive? Why?
* Do you know how to receive? Are you sure?
Put your hands on the Heart Chakra, in the thymus region, and let Reiki flow. Feel the pleasant warmth of energy filling your chest and making your inner garden grow and shine. I smiled inwardly.

You are in the day of awareness and inner vision. It is our conscience that observes and grows with the practice of the principles. The more aware we are the happier we are, the more independent we become and we understand our role in the Universe, on a par with everyone else. And then we have to ask ourselves:

* What awareness do I have of myself? Do I know who I am?
* Do I accept my role and the role of others in life? If not, why not?
* Do I really want to be conscious, or is it preferable for the time being not very conscious?

The Third Vision governs your intuition, the ability to go to the depths of you while you connect with the Universe and see things as they are, beyond the physical eyes. Your inner vision will be as sharp as your ability to keep a clear mind and a heightened awareness. The demands of everyday life and the increasingly intense and present stimuli in our life often prevent you from seeing correctly.
So you have to ask yourself:

* Can I see the situations clearly and make the best decisions?
* Do I know how to listen to my intuition? Do I believe what I feel and feel? Why?
* How do I know myself as a being, as a spirit, as a part beyond the body?

Try to understand your weakest point. What a chakra, what an organ. After treatment, put a hand on the Third Vision and another on that region. Intuition, try to understand what the energy wants to tell you about your fragility. You are becoming aware of yourself and becoming strong!

Our happiness comes from the ability to understand that we have to be complete, connected to heaven, connected to earth. Everything makes sense and life awaits us. It is worth living it if we have passion and love for it. Detachment is for those things that only harm us; love remains for life and for everything we feel we love unconditionally.

* How do you feel you connect with Reiki? What brings you?

Sahasrara is the lotus of a thousand petals, the purity that connects to the Universe. It is through this chakra that we reach supraconsciousness and the feeling of enlightenment and clarity of spirit. When the chakra is open, our mind is also open to the world of ideas. It reflects on the following:

* Do you consider yourself a person with wide horizons and an open mind?
* What do you identify as limitations of your thinking?
* What archaic things, outside of time, still restrict you?
* Do you feel a being of light? Why?
* What will you do to be more and more?

OBSERVE

Memories assail us, judgment arrests and oppresses us. So we stop wanting to be aware and look inside, we just want to do and not be. How to overcome the pain of memory, the weight of the action and judgment?

«Life has a definite purpose: to have the very darkness of the mind dissipated, and thus achieve endless happiness.» - Kentetsu Takamori

Observing does not imply attachment. When we look inside and all those heavy emotions run through us, as a result of the memories that we have been repressing, we feel sadness, suffering, physical pain plus something that is just a memory. Was. It happened. Past. In observation, in consciousness, we are neutral. We surrender to the act of compassion that allows us to heal pain and illuminate the darkness of the mind. In understanding there is no attachment, in unconditional love and compassion there is no attachment. To look inside is to have the greatest act of compassion in the entire Universe - It is to give value to the life we ​​have, creating space for happiness to develop and remain in us. It is inhaling, exhaling, centered awareness. Try to look inside without suffering, understanding the path that leads out of it.
EXERCISES

For this first day, develop your observation skills. Any Reiki activity begins with the emptying of the mind:

1- Visualize a room inside your mind, how is it?
2- Empty the room and paint the walls, ceiling and floor white.

Repeat this exercise several times over time and in between the exercises. It is important to develop the concept of a clear mind and being in the here and now. Even in the development of intuition, it is important to have an empty mind where situations can arise and reveal themselves.

Put your attention on how you connect to Reiki.

1- Feel the contact of your hands;
2- Feel how the energy touches you;
3- Feel its flow inside you.

How does the energy flow in your heart? What would it be like if you gave it color and shape?
Practice Joshin Kokyu Ho, in addition to developing your vital energy, focus on this flow of air in and out, thinking of nothing else. They look like very simple exercises but they are not. If you master them, then you have achieved full awareness of yourself.

«First we have to cultivate mindfulness. To manifest and emanate Reiki we must focus and purify the mind. » - Kenji Hamamoto\n\nAfter the attitude of observation and knowing yourself as an observer, we will deepen the mind.
THE MIND

«The mind is difficult to control: it is always fast, it leans towards what it wants. The training of the mind is good; a well-tamed mind brings happiness. » -Buddha\n\nThe mind is not a parasite or anything foreign to us. It is a part of us, a natural creation of ours and must be approached with the same compassion with which we approach a wound and with the same importance and the respect with which we face the spirit or our ideals. The mind produces, creates and helps us to have a perception of reality - sometimes concrete, sometimes distorted. And then our responsibility, that of the observer, to know how to instruct the mind so that it can work synchronously with the heart to bring us the correct view of the world. If you have an overly productive mind, do not surrender or abandon yourself to it, on the contrary: acquire mastery over it, educate it and give it compassion and love - Reiki. Have you thought about sending Reiki to your mind?

«I can give you nothing but the opportunity, the momentum, the key. I will help to make your own world visible, and that is all. » - Hermann Hesse\n\nToday we are going to focus attention on our detox. When we recite the Five Principles we are detoxifying the mind and heart, when we do self-treatment we are detoxifying all our bodies. Today is exactly what we will do - with Five Prinapios and self-treatment, we will work on our detoxification. Face these exercises with joy and let Reiki flow.

«A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.» - Lao-Tsu\n\nI hope you are enjoying these moments for the development of mindfulness, with Reiki. Today we are going to focus on practice, on the flow of energy.

«Usui Reiki Ryoho's mission is to guide you towards a peaceful and happy life, to heal others, to improve your happiness and ours.» - Mikao Usui

How were these five days for you?

I hope you have had good experiences. Today we are going to see how to bring everything we did, and a little more, to an experience in the here and now.

When we learn to read, we practice, practice and practice. It took us years to develop a correct reading, a correct diction, and we came to a time when we forgot how difficult that learning was.
Developing mindfulness requires the same spirit and vision - it takes time, a lot of time, it takes practice, practice and practice, and when we get there it seems that it was simple because it is integrated. It is with the integration that we can more quickly achieve a good result. If we apply our attention to the little things of everyday life, the sooner we learn to control the mind and live more evenly, discovering how to recognize thoughts and emotions, knowing how to manage them.
On this day we will do simple things, to develop mindfulness on a daily basis:

* When you sip your coffee or tea, enjoy every sip you take. Is it different how you feel?
* When talking to someone, just focus on the conversation and don't do two things at the same time. How did it go?
* In your work, try, when replying to an email, close everything else and focus only on that answer. How was it?
* When the phone rings, don't answer it right away. Let it ring three times and think "my words are kind". How did it go?

In addition to these tasks, you can add others. But, it also puts something very important:

* Throughout the day, recite the Five Principles several times with full attention, slowly, making every word, every feeling vibrate in you. Will this practice change your day?

The fifth day is a reflection of everything you've done. Even reading these pages can be done with as much attention as possible.

I hope that these five days have been very beautiful for you and that, above all, have taken you to moments of peace. Reiki asks us for constant practice, which serves to build us as better and happier people. We have to trust and be kind to us.
